answers.answer: I have had it for three years. Retinal exams, 2 MRI's came back normal. There are some other people who have experienced this as well, they have a forum online. Google "visual snow" and you are likely to find it. Hope it helps.

question: I am a 49 yr female with Type I Diabetes for the last 37 years.  I have diabetic retinopathy and have vision in only one eye.  I had extensive laser done in the good eye 18 years ago.  It was done in the peripheral part of the retina all around.  My vision in my good eye is 20/25.  Nearly one month ago I started to experience shimmering with sparkles all around the peripheral and it is CONSTANT.  All day every day.  No headache.  I've had the following tests:  MRI, MRI of the Carotid artery as well, CT Scan, Visual Acuity Test, complete Retinal  Exam, Angiogram of the Retina, Slit lamp exam, every exam possible!  All came out normal, other than the laser scars on my retina which have been there for 18 years.  I have not had laser since then and that was 1990.I've been to 3 Retina Specialists, a Neuro Opthamologist and now I am going to a Neurologist.  The Retina doctors flatly told me there was nothing they could do for me, they have never seen or heard of this situation going on constantly and the Neuro Opto doctor said she has seen this only rarely and most of the time, it goes away on it's own.  But not always.  She diagnosed it as Atypical Ocular Migraine secondary to Retinal changes due to age.Because I only have vision in ONE eye, I feel as if I'm going insane.  I've been taking Xanax for anxiety but don't want to get addicted.  I just need to hear that there are other people who have this CONSTANT shimmering,   There is no headache.  I did have a small ischemic stroke 3 years ago, but MRI said there was no indication of another one or TIA.PLEASE HELP and tell me there are meds to calm this shimmering down or make it go away!!!!!Thank you for your time.
title: Have you ever heard of this happening?
